title: How long does it take to get a PhD in music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most universities will require two years of coursework and if you’re getting your degree in performance or composition, some number of recitals. After that, 6–12 months of prepping for your qualification exams. Once you’ve jumped that hurdle, your dissertation will depend on how hard you work on it while you are doing other things (usually teaching, writing and/or performing). Once I passed my quals it took a few more years. It took a while because, like most of my classmates, I was busy teaching. You’re looking at 3 years minimum but probably more like 5–8.
